intro: Monochaetum strigosum, commonly known as the hairy leek orchid, is an endemic species native to Australia. It belongs to the orchid family, Orchidaceae, and is characterized by its hairy, strap-like leaves. The plant produces a tall flowering stem that bears small, greenish-white flowers. It thrives in sandy or rocky soils and is often found in coastal or inland areas. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
